titleNullable: Real Estate 2001 to 2020 State of Connecticut USA
subtitleNullable: Real Estate 2001 to 2020 State of Connecticut USA
descriptionNullable:
**Dataset Description:** The dataset encompasses details of real estate transactions within Connecticut from 2001 to 2020. **Transaction Details:** Each dataset entry details an individual transaction, including property specifics, assessed values, and sale prices. **Utility:** It's applicable for market trend analysis, evaluation of property assessment accuracy, among other real estate market research. **Data Preprocessing:** Prior to analysis, the dataset may need cleaning and preprocessing. **Analysis Potential:** Depending on analytical goals, various insights can be extracted from this information.
**Columns:** **List Year:** The year the property was listed for sale. **Date Recorded:** The official date when the sale was recorded in public records. **Town:** The town in Connecticut where the property is located. **Address:** The street address of the property. **Assessed Value:** The valuation of the property for tax purposes, as determined by an assessor. **Sale Amount:** The actual price the property was sold for. **Sales Ratio:** The ratio of the sale amount to the assessed value, indicating how they compare. **Property Type:** The classification of the property (e.g., residential, commercial). **Residential Type:** More specific type of residential property, if applicable (e.g., single-family home). **Latitude:** The geographic coordinate specifying the north-south position of the property. **Longitude:** The geographic coordinate specifying the east-west position of the property.
**Note:** The dataset presented is a refined extract from the comprehensive collection found at : [https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/anoopjohny/real-estate-sales-2001-2020-state-of-connecticut](url)(Real Estate Sales 2001-2020 State of Connecticut). Enhancements to the original dataset include the addition of geographical coordinates, with Latitude and Longitude columns integrated using the **geocoder** library.
